verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha:

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as I exalted thee out of the dust, and made thee prince over my people Israel; and thou hast walked in the way of Jeroboam, and hast made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;
verses.ct: "I lifted you up from nothing and made you ruler over my people Israel. But you have followed the same path as Jeroboam and led my people Israel into sin, making me angry with their sins.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will take away the posterity of Baasha, and the posterity of his house; and will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am going to wipe out the descendants of Baasha and the descendants of his family. I will make your household end up just like the household of Jeroboam son of Nebat.

verses.kjv: Him that dieth of Baasha in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth of his in the fields shall the fowls of the air eat.
verses.ct: "Anyone from Baasha's family who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and anyone who dies in the open country will be eaten by birds."

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Baasha — his accomplishments and his power — is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: So Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah: and Elah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Baasha died and was buried in Tirzah, and his son Elah became king after him.

verses.kjv: And also by the hand of the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani came the word of the LORD against Baasha, and against his house, even for all the evil that he did in the sight of the LORD, in provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam; and because he killed him.
verses.ct: The LORD's message had come through the prophet Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha and his entire household — both because of all the evil he did before the LORD, provoking God's anger through his actions by being like the household of Jeroboam, and also because he had killed Jeroboam's family.

verses.kjv: In the twenty and sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, two years.
verses.ct: In the 26th year of King Asa of Judah, Elah son of Baasha became king over Israel in Tirzah, and he ruled for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And his servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him, as he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza steward of his house in Tirzah.
verses.ct: His officer Zimri, who commanded half of his chariot forces, plotted against him. While Elah was in Tirzah getting drunk at the home of Arza, the palace administrator,

verses.kjv: And Zimri went in and smote him, and killed him, in the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Zimri came in, struck him down, and killed him. This was in the 27th year of King Asa of Judah, and Zimri took the throne in his place.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he slew all the house of Baasha: he left him not one that pisseth against a wall, neither of his kinsfolks, nor of his friends.
verses.ct: As soon as he began to rule and was seated on the throne, he killed every member of Baasha's household. He didn't spare a single male — not a relative, not a friend.

verses.kjv: Thus did Zimri destroy all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
verses.ct: So Zimri destroyed Baasha's entire family, fulfilling the LORD's message that he had spoken against Baasha through the prophet Jehu.

verses.kjv: For all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, by which they sinned, and by which they made Israel to sin, in provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
verses.ct: This happened because of all the sins of Baasha and his son Elah — sins they committed and caused Israel to commit, provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Elah and all that he did is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: In the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah did Zimri reign seven days in Tirzah. And the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
verses.ct: In the 27th year of King Asa of Judah, Zimri ruled for 7 days in Tirzah. At that time, the Israelite army was camped in a siege against Gibbethon, a Philistine city.

verses.kjv: And the people that were encamped heard say, Zimri hath conspired, and hath also slain the king: wherefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the host, king over Israel that day in the camp.
verses.ct: When the troops in the camp heard the news that Zimri had conspired against the king and assassinated him, the entire army of Israel made Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel that very day in the camp.

verses.kjv: And Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
verses.ct: Then Omri marched up from Gibbethon with the whole Israelite army, and they laid siege to Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the palace of the king’s house, and burnt the king’s house over him with fire, and died,
verses.ct: When Zimri realized the city had been captured, he went into the fortified section of the royal palace and set the palace on fire around himself, and he died.

verses.kjv: For his sins which he sinned in doing evil in the sight of the LORD, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.
verses.ct: This was because of the sins he committed by doing what was evil before the LORD, following the same path as Jeroboam and committing the same sin that led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Zimri, including his conspiracy, is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.
verses.ct: At that point, the people of Israel split into 2 factions: half the people supported Tibni son of Ginath and wanted to make him king, while the other half supported Omri.

verses.kjv: But the people that followed Omri prevailed against the people that followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
verses.ct: But Omri's supporters overpowered those who followed Tibni son of Ginath. Tibni died, and Omri became king.

verses.kjv: In the thirty and first year of Asa king of Judah began Omri to reign over Israel, twelve years: six years reigned he in Tirzah.
verses.ct: In the 31st year of King Asa of Judah, Omri became king over Israel and ruled for 12 years. He spent 6 of those years ruling from Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And he bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver, and built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, after the name of Shemer, owner of the hill, Samaria.
verses.ct: He purchased the hill of Samaria from Shemer for 2 talents of silver, built a city on the hill, and named it Samaria after Shemer, the previous owner of the hill.

verses.kjv: But Omri wrought evil in the eyes of the LORD, and did worse than all that were before him.
verses.ct: But Omri did what was evil before the LORD and was worse than everyone who came before him.

verses.kjv: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin, to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
verses.ct: He followed completely in the path of Jeroboam son of Nebat and in the sin through which Jeroboam had led Israel to sin, provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he shewed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Omri — his accomplishments and the power he demonstrated — is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria: and Ahab his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Omri died and was buried in Samaria, and his son Ahab became king after him.

verses.kjv: And in the thirty and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty and two years.
verses.ct: In the 38th year of King Asa of Judah, Ahab son of Omri became king over Israel, and he ruled over Israel from Samaria for 22 years.

verses.kjv: And Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD above all that were before him.
verses.ct: Ahab son of Omri did what was evil before the LORD, more than anyone who came before him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Zidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshipped him.
verses.ct: As if it weren't bad enough to follow in the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, he also married Jezebel, the daughter of King Ethbaal of the Sidonians, and then went and served Baal and worshiped him.

verses.kjv: And he reared up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
verses.ct: He set up an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal that he had built in Samaria.

verses.kjv: And Ahab made a grove; and Ahab did more to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel that were before him.
verses.ct: Ahab also made an Asherah pole. Ahab did more to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel who came before him.

verses.kjv: In his days did Hiel the Bethelite build Jericho: he laid the foundation thereof in Abiram his firstborn, and set up the gates thereof in his youngest son Segub, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.ct: During his reign, Hiel from Bethel rebuilt Jericho. He lost his firstborn son Abiram when he laid the foundation, and he lost his youngest son Segub when he set up the gates — exactly as the LORD had spoken through Joshua son of Nun.
